ipxact:register.ipxact:name: fflags
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: The fields within the ``fcsr`` can also be accessed individually through different CSR addresses, and separate assembler pseudoinstructions are defined for these accesses. The FRRM instruction reads the Rounding Mode field ``frm`` and copies it into the least-significant three bits of integer register *rd*, with zero in all other bits. FSRM swaps the value in frm by copying the original value into integer register *rd*, and then writing a new value obtained from the three least-significant bits of integer register *rs1* into ``frm``. FRFLAGS and FSFLAGS are defined analogously for the Accrued Exception Flags field ``fflags``.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: NV
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The accrued exception flags indicate the exception conditions that have arisen on any floating-point arithmetic instruction since the field was last reset by software. The base RISC-V ISA does not support generating a trap on the setting of a floating-point exception flag.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: DZ
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The accrued exception flags indicate the exception conditions that have arisen on any floating-point arithmetic instruction since the field was last reset by software. The base RISC-V ISA does not support generating a trap on the setting of a floating-point exception flag.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: OF
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The accrued exception flags indicate the exception conditions that have arisen on any floating-point arithmetic instruction since the field was last reset by software. The base RISC-V ISA does not support generating a trap on the setting of a floating-point exception flag.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: UF
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The accrued exception flags indicate the exception conditions that have arisen on any floating-point arithmetic instruction since the field was last reset by software. The base RISC-V ISA does not support generating a trap on the setting of a floating-point exception flag.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: NX
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The accrued exception flags indicate the exception conditions that have arisen on any floating-point arithmetic instruction since the field was last reset by software. The base RISC-V ISA does not support generating a trap on the setting of a floating-point exception flag.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: frm
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: The fields within the ``fcsr`` can also be accessed individually through different CSR addresses, and separate assembler pseudoinstructions are defined for these accesses. The FRRM instruction reads the Rounding Mode field ``frm`` and copies it into the least-significant three bits of integer register *rd*, with zero in all other bits. FSRM swaps the value in frm by copying the original value into integer register *rd*, and then writing a new value obtained from the three least-significant bits of integer register *rs1* into ``frm``. FRFLAGS and FSFLAGS are defined analogously for the Accrued Exception Flags field ``fflags``.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: FRM
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Floating-point operations use either a static rounding mode encoded in the instruction, or a dynamic rounding mode held in ``frm``. Rounding modes are encoded as shown in the enumerated value. A value of 111 in the instruction’s *rm* field selects the dynamic rounding mode held in ``frm``. If ``frm`` is set to an invalid value (101–111), any subsequent attempt to execute a floating-point operation with a dynamic rounding mode will raise an illegal instruction exception. Some instructions, including widening conversions, have the *rm* field but are nevertheless unaffected by the rounding mode; software should set their *rm* field to RNE (000).

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: RNE
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Round to Nearest, ties to Even

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: RMM
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Round to Nearest, ties to Max Magnitude

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: DYN
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: In instruction’s *rm* field, selects dynamic rounding mode; In Rounding Mode register, *Invalid*.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: fcsr
ipxact:register.ipxact:description:
The floating-point control and status register, ``fcsr``, is a RISC-V control and status register (CSR). It is a read/write register that selects the dynamic rounding mode for floating-point arithmetic operations and holds the accrued exception flags.
The ``fcsr`` register can be read and written with the FRCSR and FSCSR instructions, which are assembler pseudoinstructions built on the underlying CSR access instructions. FRCSR reads ``fcsr`` by copying it into integer register *rd*. FSCSR swaps the value in ``fcsr`` by copying the original value into integer register *rd*, and then writing a new value obtained from integer register *rs1* into ``fcsr``.
The fields within the ``fcsr`` can also be accessed individually through different CSR addresses, and separate assembler pseudoinstructions are defined for these accesses. The FRRM instruction reads the Rounding Mode field ``frm`` and copies it into the least-significant three bits of integer register *rd*, with zero in all other bits. FSRM swaps the value in frm by copying the original value into integer register *rd*, and then writing a new value obtained from the three least-significant bits of integer register *rs1* into ``frm``. FRFLAGS and FSFLAGS are defined analogously for the Accrued Exception Flags field ``fflags``.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: FRM
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Floating-point operations use either a static rounding mode encoded in the instruction, or a dynamic rounding mode held in ``frm``. Rounding modes are encoded as shown in the enumerated value. A value of 111 in the instruction’s *rm* field selects the dynamic rounding mode held in ``frm``. If ``frm`` is set to an invalid value (101–111), any subsequent attempt to execute a floating-point operation with a dynamic rounding mode will raise an illegal instruction exception. Some instructions, including widening conversions, have the *rm* field but are nevertheless unaffected by the rounding mode; software should set their *rm* field to RNE (000).

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: RNE
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Round to Nearest, ties to Even

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: RMM
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Round to Nearest, ties to Max Magnitude

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: DYN
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: In instruction’s *rm* field, selects dynamic rounding mode; In Rounding Mode register, *Invalid*.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: NV
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The accrued exception flags indicate the exception conditions that have arisen on any floating-point arithmetic instruction since the field was last reset by software. The base RISC-V ISA does not support generating a trap on the setting of a floating-point exception flag.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: DZ
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The accrued exception flags indicate the exception conditions that have arisen on any floating-point arithmetic instruction since the field was last reset by software. The base RISC-V ISA does not support generating a trap on the setting of a floating-point exception flag.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: OF
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The accrued exception flags indicate the exception conditions that have arisen on any floating-point arithmetic instruction since the field was last reset by software. The base RISC-V ISA does not support generating a trap on the setting of a floating-point exception flag.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: UF
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The accrued exception flags indicate the exception conditions that have arisen on any floating-point arithmetic instruction since the field was last reset by software. The base RISC-V ISA does not support generating a trap on the setting of a floating-point exception flag.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: NX
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The accrued exception flags indicate the exception conditions that have arisen on any floating-point arithmetic instruction since the field was last reset by software. The base RISC-V ISA does not support generating a trap on the setting of a floating-point exception flag.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: sstatus
ipxact:register.ipxact:description:
The ``sstatus`` register keeps track of the processor’s current operating state.
The ``sstatus`` register is a subset of the ``mstatus`` register.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SD
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The SD bit is a read-only bit that summarizes whether either the FS, VS, or XS fields signal the presence of some dirty state that will require saving extended user context to memory. If FS, XS, and VS are all read-only zero, then SD is also always zero.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MXR
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The MXR bit modifies the privilege with which loads access virtual memory. When MXR=0, only loads from pages marked readable will succeed. When MXR=1, loads from pages marked either readable or executable (R=1 or X=1) will succeed. MXR has no effect when page-based virtual memory is not in effect.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SUM
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The SUM (permit Supervisor User Memory access) bit modifies the privilege with which S-mode loads and stores access virtual memory. When SUM=0, S-mode memory accesses to pages that are accessible by U-mode will fault. When SUM=1, these accesses are permitted. SUM has no effect when page-based virtual memory is not in effect. Note that, while SUM is ordinarily ignored when not executing in S-mode, it *is* in effect when MPRV=1 and MPP=S. SUM is read-only 0 if S-mode is not supported or if ``satp``.MODE is read-only 0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: XS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
The XS field is used to reduce the cost of context save and restore by setting and tracking the current state of the user-mode extensions. The XS field encodes the status of the additional user-mode extensions and associated state.
This field can be checked by a context switch routine to quickly determine whether a state save or restore is required. If a save or restore is required, additional instructions and CSRs are typically required to effect and optimize the process.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: Initial
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: None dirty or clean, some on

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: FS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
The FS field is used to reduce the cost of context save and restore by setting and tracking the current state of the floating-point unit. The FS field encodes the status of the floating-point unit state, including the floating-point registers ``f0–f31`` and the CSRs ``fcsr``, ``frm``, and ``fflags``.
This field can be checked by a context switch routine to quickly determine whether a state save or restore is required. If a save or restore is required, additional instructions and CSRs are typically required to effect and optimize the process.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SPP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: SPP bit indicates the privilege level at which a hart was executing before entering supervisor mode. When a trap is taken, SPP is set to 0 if the trap originated from user mode, or 1 otherwise. When an SRET instruction is executed to return from the trap handler, the privilege level is set to user mode if the SPP bit is 0, or supervisor mode if the SPP bit is 1; SPP is then set to 0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SPIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The SPIE bit indicates whether supervisor interrupts were enabled prior to trapping into supervisor mode. When a trap is taken into supervisor mode, SPIE is set to SIE, and SIE is set to 0. When an SRET instruction is executed, SIE is set to SPIE, then SPIE is set to 1.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: UPIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When a URET instruction is executed, UIE is set to UPIE, and UPIE is set to 1.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The SIE bit enables or disables all interrupts in supervisor mode. When SIE is clear, interrupts are not taken while in supervisor mode. When the hart is running in user-mode, the value in SIE is ignored, and supervisor-level interrupts are enabled. The supervisor can disable individual interrupt sources using the ``sie`` CSR.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: UIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The UIE bit enables or disables user-mode interrupts.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: sie
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: The ``sie`` is the register containing supervisor interrupt enable bits.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Reserved_10
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved.``Legal Values:``0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SEIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: SEIE is the interrupt-enable bit for supervisor-level external interrupts.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: UEIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: User-level external interrupts are disabled when the UEIE bit in the sie register is clear.``Legal Values:``0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Reserved_6
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved.``Legal Values:``0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: STIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: STIE is the interrupt-enable bit for supervisor-level timer interrupts.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: UTIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: User-level timer interrupts are disabled when the UTIE bit in the sie register is clear.``Legal Values:``0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Reserved_2
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved.``Legal Values:``0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SSIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: SSIE is the interrupt-enable bit for supervisor-level software interrupts.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: USIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: User-level software interrupts are disabled when the USIE bit in the sie register is clear.``Legal Values:``0.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: stvec
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: The ``stvec`` register holds trap vector configuration, consisting of a vector base address (BASE) and a vector mode (MODE).

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: BASE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The BASE field in stvec is a WARL field that can hold any valid virtual or physical address, subject to the following alignment constraints: when MODE=Direct the address must be 4-byte aligned, and when MODE=Vectored the address must be 256-byte aligned.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MODE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When MODE=Direct, all traps into supervisor mode cause the ``pc`` to be set to the address in the BASE field. When MODE=Vectored, all synchronous exceptions into supervisor mode cause the ``pc`` to be set to the address in the BASE field, whereas interrupts cause the ``pc`` to be set to the address in the BASE field plus four times the interrupt cause number.``Legal Values :``0,1.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: Vectored
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Asynchronous interrupts set pc to BASE+4×cause.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: scounteren
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: The counter-enable register ``scounteren`` controls the availability of the hardware performance monitoring counters to U-mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: HPMn
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When HPMn is clear, attempts to read the ``hpmcountern`` register while executing in U-mode will cause an illegal instruction exception. When this bit is set, access to the corresponding register is permitted.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: IR
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When IR is clear, attempts to read the ``instret`` register while executing in U-mode will cause an illegal instruction exception. When this bit is set, access to the corresponding register is permitted.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: TM
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When TM is clear, attempts to read the ``time`` register while executing in U-mode will cause an illegal instruction exception. When this bit is set, access to the corresponding register is permitted.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: CY
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When CY is clear, attempts to read the ``cycle`` register while executing in U-mode will cause an illegal instruction exception. When this bit is set, access to the corresponding register is permitted.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: sscratch
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: The ``sscratch`` register is dedicated for use by the supervisor.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SSCRATCH
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Typically, ``sscratch`` is used to hold a pointer to the hart-local supervisor context while the hart is executing user code. At the beginning of a trap handler, ``sscratch`` is swapped with a user register to provide an initial working register.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: sepc
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: When a trap is taken into S-mode, ``sepc`` is written with the virtual address of the instruction that was interrupted or that encountered the exception. Otherwise, ``sepc`` is never written by the implementation, though it may be explicitly written by software.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SEPC
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The low bit of SEPC (SEPC[0]) is always zero. On implementations that support only IALIGN=32, the two low bits (SEPC[1:0]) are always zero.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: scause
ipxact:register.ipxact:description:
When a trap is taken into S-mode, ``scause`` is written with a code indicating the event that caused the trap. Otherwise, ``scause`` is never written by the implementation, though it may be explicitly written by software.
Supervisor cause register (``scause``) values after trap are shown in the following table. ========= ============== ============================== Interrupt Exception Code Description ========= ============== ============================== 1 0 *Reserved* 1 1 Supervisor software interrupt 1 2-4 *Reserved* 1 5 Supervisor timer interrupt 1 6-8 *Reserved* 1 9 Supervisor external interrupt 1 10-15 *Reserved* 1 ≥16 *Designated for platform use* 0 0 Instruction address misaligned 0 1 Instruction access fault 0 2 Illegal instruction 0 3 Breakpoint 0 4 Load address misaligned 0 5 Load access fault 0 6 Store/AMO address misaligned 0 7 Store/AMO access fault 0 8 Environment call from U-mode 0 9 Environment call from S-mode 0 10-11 *Reserved* 0 12 Instruction page fault 0 13 Load page fault 0 14 *Reserved* 0 15 Store/AMO page fault 0 16-23 *Reserved* 0 24-31 *Designated for custom use* 0 32-47 *Reserved* 0 48-63 *Designated for custom use* 0 ≥64 *Reserved* ========= ============== ==============================

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Interrupt
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The Interrupt bit in the ``scause`` register is set if the trap was caused by an interrupt.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Exception_Code
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The Exception Code field contains a code identifying the last exception or interrupt.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: stval
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: When a trap is taken into S-mode, ``stval`` is written with exception-specific information to assist software in handling the trap. Otherwise, ``stval`` is never written by the implementation, though it may be explicitly written by software. The hardware platform will specify which exceptions must set ``stval`` informatively and which may unconditionally set it to zero.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: STVAL
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
If ``stval`` is written with a nonzero value when a breakpoint, address-misaligned, access-fault, or page-fault exception occurs on an instruction fetch, load, or store, then ``stval`` will contain the faulting virtual address.
If ``stval`` is written with a nonzero value when a misaligned load or store causes an access-fault or page-fault exception, then ``stval`` will contain the virtual address of the portion of the access that caused the fault.
If ``stval`` is written with a nonzero value when an instruction access-fault or page-fault exception occurs on a system with variable-length instructions, then ``stval`` will contain the virtual address of the portion of the instruction that caused the fault, while ``sepc`` will point to the beginning of the instruction.
The ``stval`` register can optionally also be used to return the faulting instruction bits on an illegal instruction exception (``sepc`` points to the faulting instruction in memory). If ``stval`` is written with a nonzero value when an illegal-instruction exception occurs, then ``stval`` will contain the shortest of:
* the actual faulting instruction * the first ILEN bits of the faulting instruction * the first SXLEN bits of the faulting instruction
The value loaded into ``stval`` on an illegal-instruction exception is right-justified and all unused upper bits are cleared to zero. For other traps, ``stval`` is set to zero, but a future standard may redefine ``stval’s`` setting for other traps.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: sip
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: The ``sip`` register contains information on pending interrupts.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Reserved_10
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved.``Legal Values:``0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SEIP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: SEIP is the interrupt-pending bit for supervisor-level external interrupts.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: UEIP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: UEIP may be written by S-mode software to indicate to U-mode that an external interrupt is pending.``Legal Values:``0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Reserved_6
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved.``Legal Values:``0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: STIP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: SEIP is the interrupt-pending bit for supervisor-level timer interrupts.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: UTIP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: A user-level timer interrupt is pending if the UTIP bit in the sip register is set.``Legal Values:``0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Reserved_2
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved.``Legal Values:``0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SSIP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: SSIP is the interrupt-pending bit for supervisor-level software interrupts.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: USIP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: A user-level software interrupt is triggered on the current hart by riting 1 to its user software interrupt-pending (USIP) bit.``Legal Values:``0.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: satp
ipxact:register.ipxact:description:
The ``satp`` register controls supervisor-mode address translation and protection.
The ``satp`` register is considered active when the effective privilege mode is S-mode or U-mode. Executions of the address-translation algorithm may only begin using a given value of ``satp`` when ``satp`` is active.
.. note:: Writing ``satp`` does not imply any ordering constraints between page-table updates and subsequent address translations, nor does it imply any invalidation of address-translation caches. If the new address space’s page tables have been modified, or if an ASID is reused, it may be necessary to execute an SFENCE.VMA instruction after, or in some cases before, writing ``satp``.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MODE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
This bitfield selects the current address-translation scheme.
When MODE=Bare, supervisor virtual addresses are equal to supervisor physical addresses, and there is no additional memory protection beyond the physical memory protection scheme.
To select MODE=Bare, software must write zero to the remaining fields of ``satp`` (bits 30–0). Attempting to select MODE=Bare with a nonzero pattern in the remaining fields has an ``unspecified`` effect on the value that the remaining fields assume and an ``unspecified`` effect on address translation and protection behavior.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: ASID
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This bitfield facilitates address-translation fences on a per-address-space basis.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: PPN
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This bitfield holds the root page table, i.e., its supervisor physical address divided by 4 KiB.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mstatus
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: The ``mstatus`` register keeps track of and controls the hart’s current operating state.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SD
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The SD bit is a read-only bit that summarizes whether either the FS, VS, or XS fields signal the presence of some dirty state that will require saving extended user context to memory. If FS, XS, and VS are all read-only zero, then SD is also always zero.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: WPRI3
ipxact:field.ipxact:displayName: Reserved Writes Preserve Values, Reads Ignore Value
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved Writes Preserve Values, Reads Ignore Value

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: TSR
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The TSR bit supports intercepting the supervisor exception return instruction, SRET. When TSR=1, attempts to execute SRET while executing in S-mode will raise an illegal instruction exception. When TSR=0, this operation is permitted in S-mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: TW
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The TW bit supports intercepting the WFI instruction. When TW=0, the WFI instruction may execute in lower privilege modes when not prevented for some other reason. When TW=1, then if WFI is executed in any less-privileged mode, and it does not complete within an implementation-specific, bounded time limit, the WFI instruction causes an illegal instruction exception. The time limit may always be 0, in which case WFI always causes an illegal instruction exception in less-privileged modes when TW=1.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: TVM
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The TVM bit supports intercepting supervisor virtual-memory management operations. When TVM=1, attempts to read or write the ``satp`` CSR or execute an SFENCE.VMA or SINVAL.VMA instruction while executing in S-mode will raise an illegal instruction exception. When TVM=0, these operations are permitted in S-mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MXR
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The MXR bit modifies the privilege with which loads access virtual memory. When MXR=0, only loads from pages marked readable will succeed. When MXR=1, loads from pages marked either readable or executable (R=1 or X=1) will succeed. MXR has no effect when page-based virtual memory is not in effect.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SUM
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The SUM (permit Supervisor User Memory access) bit modifies the privilege with which S-mode loads and stores access virtual memory. When SUM=0, S-mode memory accesses to pages that are accessible by U-mode will fault. When SUM=1, these accesses are permitted. SUM has no effect when page-based virtual memory is not in effect. Note that, while SUM is ordinarily ignored when not executing in S-mode, it is in effect when MPRV=1 and MPP=S.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MPRV
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The MPRV (Modify PRiVilege) bit modifies the effective privilege mode, i.e., the privilege level at which loads and stores execute. When MPRV=0, loads and stores behave as normal, using the translation and protection mechanisms of the current privilege mode. When MPRV=1, load and store memory addresses are translated and protected, and endianness is applied, as though the current privilege mode were set to MPP. Instruction address-translation and protection are unaffected by the setting of MPRV.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: XS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
The XS field is used to reduce the cost of context save and restore by setting and tracking the current state of the user-mode extensions. The XS field encodes the status of the additional user-mode extensions and associated state.
This field can be checked by a context switch routine to quickly determine whether a state save or restore is required. If a save or restore is required, additional instructions and CSRs are typically required to effect and optimize the process.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: Initial
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: None dirty or clean, some on

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: FS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
The FS field is used to reduce the cost of context save and restore by setting and tracking the current state of the floating-point unit. The FS field encodes the status of the floating-point unit state, including the floating-point registers ``f0–f31`` and the CSRs ``fcsr``, ``frm``, and ``fflags``.
This field can be checked by a context switch routine to quickly determine whether a state save or restore is required. If a save or restore is required, additional instructions and CSRs are typically required to effect and optimize the process.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MPP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Holds the previous privilege mode for machine mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: VS
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: V extension is not supported VS=0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SPP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Holds the previous privilege mode for supervisor mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MPIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicates whether machine interrupts were enabled prior to trapping into machine mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: UBE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: UBE controls whether explicit load and store memory accesses made from U-mode are little-endian (UBE=0) or big-endian (UBE=1).

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SPIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Indicates whether supervisor interrupts were enabled prior to trapping into supervisor mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: WPRI2
ipxact:field.ipxact:displayName: Reserved Writes Preserve Values, Reads Ignore Value
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved Writes Preserve Values, Reads Ignore Value

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Global interrupt-enable bit for Machine mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: WPRI1
ipxact:field.ipxact:displayName: Reserved Writes Preserve Values, Reads Ignore Value
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved Writes Preserve Values, Reads Ignore Value

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Global interrupt-enable bit for Supervisor mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: WPRI0
ipxact:field.ipxact:displayName: Reserved Writes Preserve Values, Reads Ignore Value
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved Writes Preserve Values, Reads Ignore Value

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: misa
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: The misa CSR is reporting the ISA supported by the hart.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MXL
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The MXL field encodes the native base integer ISA width.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Extensions
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The Extensions field encodes the presence of the standard extensions, with a single bit per letter of the alphabet.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: J
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: *Tentatively reserved for Dynamically Translated Languages extension.*

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: medeleg
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Provides individual read/write bits to indicate that certain exceptions should be processed directly by a lower privilege level.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Synchronous_Exceptions
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: There is a bit position allocated for every synchronous exception, with the index of the bit position equal to the value returned in the ``mcause`` register.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mideleg
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Provides individual read/write bits to indicate that certain interrupts should be processed directly by a lower privilege level.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Interrupts
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This bitfield holds trap delegation bits for individual interrupts, with the layout of bits matching those in the ``mip`` register.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mie
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This register contains machine interrupt enable bits.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Reserved_12
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved.``Legal Values:``0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MEIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enables machine mode external interrupts.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Reserved_10
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved.``Legal Values:``0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SEIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enables supervisor mode external interrupts.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: UEIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: enables U-mode external interrupts.``Legal Values:``0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MTIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enables machine mode timer interrupts.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Reserved_6
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved.``Legal Values:``0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: STIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enables supervisor mode timer interrupts.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: UTIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: timer interrupt-enable bit for U-mode.``Legal Values:``0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MSIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enables machine mode software interrupts.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Reserved_2
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved.``Legal Values:``0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SSIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enables supervisor mode software interrupts.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: USIE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: enable U-mode software interrrupts.``Legal Values:``0.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mtvec
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This register holds trap vector configuration, consisting of a vector base address and a vector mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: BASE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The BASE field in mtvec is a WARL field that can hold any valid virtual or physical address, subject to the following alignment constraints: when MODE=Direct the address must be 4-byte aligned, and when MODE=Vectored the address must be 256-byte aligned.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MODE
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Imposes additional alignment constraints on the value in the BASE field.``Legal Values :``0,1.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mcountern
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This register controls the availability of the hardware performance-monitoring counters to the next-lowest privileged mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: HPMn
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When HPMn is clear, attempts to read the ``hpmcountern`` register while executing in S-mode or U-mode will cause an illegal instruction exception. When this bit is set, access to the corresponding register is permitted in the next implemented privilege mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: IR
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When IR is clear, attempts to read the ``instret`` register while executing in S-mode or U-mode will cause an illegal instruction exception. When this bit is set, access to the corresponding register is permitted in the next implemented privilege mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: TM
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When TM is clear, attempts to read the ``time`` register while executing in S-mode or U-mode will cause an illegal instruction exception. When this bit is set, access to the corresponding register is permitted in the next implemented privilege mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: CY
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When CY is clear, attempts to read the ``cycle`` register while executing in S-mode or U-mode will cause an illegal instruction exception. When this bit is set, access to the corresponding register is permitted in the next implemented privilege mode.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: hpmevent
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This register controls which event causes the corresponding counter to increment.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: mhpmevent
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: event selector CSRs

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mscratch
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This register is used to hold a value dedicated to Machine mode. Attempts to access without Machine mode level raise illegal instruction exception.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: mscratch
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Holds a value dedicated to Machine mode.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mepc
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This register must be able to hold all valid virtual addresses.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: mepc
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When a trap is taken into M-mode, ``mepc`` is written with the virtual address of the instruction that was interrupted or that encountered the exception.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mcause
ipxact:register.ipxact:description:
When a trap is taken into M-mode, mcause is written with a code indicating the event that caused the trap.
Machine cause register (``mcause``) values after trap are shown in the following table. ========= ============== ============================== Interrupt Exception Code Description ========= ============== ============================== 1 0 *Reserved* 1 1 Supervisor software interrupt 1 2-4 *Reserved* 1 5 Supervisor timer interrupt 1 6-8 *Reserved* 1 9 Supervisor external interrupt 1 10-15 *Reserved* 1 ≥16 *Designated for platform use* 0 0 Instruction address misaligned 0 1 Instruction access fault 0 2 Illegal instruction 0 3 Breakpoint 0 4 Load address misaligned 0 5 Load access fault 0 6 Store/AMO address misaligned 0 7 Store/AMO access fault 0 8 Environment call from U-mode 0 9 Environment call from S-mode 0 10-11 *Reserved* 0 12 Instruction page fault 0 13 Load page fault 0 14 *Reserved* 0 15 Store/AMO page fault 0 16-23 *Reserved* 0 24-31 *Designated for custom use* 0 32-47 *Reserved* 0 48-63 *Designated for custom use* 0 ≥64 *Reserved* ========= ============== ==============================

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Interrupt
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This bit is set if the trap was caused by an interrupt.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: exception_code
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This field contains a code identifying the last exception or interrupt.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mtval
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: When a trap is taken into M-mode, mtval is either set to zero or written with exception-specific information to assist software in handling the trap.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: mtval
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
If ``mtval`` is written with a nonzero value when a breakpoint, address-misaligned, access-fault, or page-fault exception occurs on an instruction fetch, load, or store, then mtval will contain the faulting virtual address.
If ``mtval`` is written with a nonzero value when a misaligned load or store causes an access-fault or page-fault exception, then ``mtval`` will contain the virtual address of the portion of the access that caused the fault.
If ``mtval`` is written with a nonzero value when an instruction access-fault or page-fault exception occurs on a system with variable-length instructions, then ``mtval`` will contain the virtual address of the portion of the instruction that caused the fault, while ``mepc`` will point to the beginning of the instruction.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mip
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This register contains machine interrupt pending bits.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Reserved_12
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved.``Legal Values:``0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MEIP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The interrupt-pending bit for machine-level external interrupts.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Reserved_10
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved.``Legal Values:``0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SEIP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The interrupt-pending bit for supervisor-level external interrupts.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: UEIP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: enables external interrupts.``Legal Values:``0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MTIP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The interrupt-pending bit for machine-level timer interrupts.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Reserved_6
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved.``Legal Values:``0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: STIP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The interrupt-pending bit for supervisor-level timer interrupts.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: UTIP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Correspond to timer interrupt-pending bits for user interrupt.``Legal Values:``0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: MSIP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The interrupt-pending bit for machine-level software interrupts.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: Reserved_2
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Reserved.``Legal Values:``0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: SSIP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: The interrupt-pending bit for supervisor-level software interrupts.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: USIP
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: A hart to directly write its own USIP bits when running in the appropriate mode.``Legal Values:``0.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: pmp3cfg
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Holds the configuration.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: pmp2cfg
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Holds the configuration.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: pmp1cfg
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Holds the configuration.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: pmp0cfg
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Holds the configuration.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: pmp7cfg
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Holds the configuration.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: pmp6cfg
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Holds the configuration.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: pmp5cfg
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Holds the configuration.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: pmp4cfg
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Holds the configuration.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: pmp11cfg
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Holds the configuration.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: pmp10cfg
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Holds the configuration.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: pmp9cfg
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Holds the configuration.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: pmp8cfg
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Holds the configuration.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: pmp15cfg
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Holds the configuration.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: pmp14cfg
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Holds the configuration.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: pmp13cfg
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Holds the configuration.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: pmp12cfg
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Holds the configuration.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: pmpaddr
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Address register for Physical Memory Protection.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: address
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Encodes bits 33-2 of a 34-bit physical address.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: icache
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Custom Register to enable/disable for Icache [bit 0]

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: icache
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Custom Register

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: dcache
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Custom Register to enable/disable for Dcache [bit 0]

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: dcache
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Custom Register

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: tselect
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This register determines which trigger is accessible through the other trigger registers.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: index
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
The set of accessible triggers must start at 0, and be contiguous.
Writes of values greater than or equal to the number of supported triggers may result in a different value in this register than what was written. To verify that what they wrote is a valid index, debuggers can read back the value and check that ``tselect`` holds what they wrote.
Since triggers can be used both by Debug Mode and M-mode, the debugger must restore this register if it modifies it.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: type
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Type of trigger.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: no_trigger
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: There is no trigger at this ``tselect``.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: legacy_address_match_trigger
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: The trigger is a legacy SiFive address match trigger. These should not be implemented and aren’t further documented here.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: address_data_match_trigger
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: The trigger is an address/data match trigger. The remaining bits in this register act as described in ``mcontrol``.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: instruction_count_trigger
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: The trigger is an instruction count trigger. The remaining bits in this register act as described in ``icount``.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: interrupt_trigger
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: The trigger is an interrupt trigger. The remaining bits in this register act as described in ``itrigger``.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: exception_trigger
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: The trigger is an exception trigger. The remaining bits in this register act as described in ``etrigger``.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: trigger_exists
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: This trigger exists (so enumeration shouldn’t terminate), but is not currently available.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: dmode
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: This bit is only writable from Debug Mode.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: D_and_M_mode
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Both Debug and M-mode can write the ``tdata`` registers at the selected ``tselect``.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: M_mode_only
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Only Debug Mode can write the ``tdata`` registers at the selected ``tselect``. Writes from other modes are ignored.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: data
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Trigger-specific data.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: data
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Trigger-specific data.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: data
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Trigger-specific data.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: info
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
One bit for each possible ``type`` enumerated in ``tdata1``. Bit N corresponds to type N. If the bit is set, then that type is supported by the currently selected trigger.
If the currently selected trigger doesn’t exist, this field contains 1.
If ``type`` is not writable, this register may be unimplemented, in which case reading it causes an illegal instruction exception. In this case the debugger can read the only supported type from ``tdata1``.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: xdebugver
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Shows the version of the debug support.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: no_ext_debug
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: There is no external debug support.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: ext_debug_spec
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: External debug support exists as it is described in the riscv-debug-release document.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: ext_debug_no_spec
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: There is external debug support, but it does not conform to any available version of the riscv-debug-release spec.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: ebreakm
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Shows the behvior of the ``ebreak`` instruction in machine mode.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: break_as_spec
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: ``ebreak`` instructions in M-mode behave as described in the Privileged Spec.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: break_to_debug
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: ``ebreak`` instructions in M-mode enter Debug Mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: ebreaks
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Shows the behvior of the ``ebreak`` instruction in supervisor mode.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: break_as_spec
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: ``ebreak`` instructions in S-mode behave as described in the Privileged Spec.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: break_to_debug
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: ``ebreak`` instructions in S-mode enter Debug Mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: ebreaku
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Shows the behvior of the ``ebreak`` instruction in user mode.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: break_as_spec
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: ``ebreak`` instructions in U-mode behave as described in the Privileged Spec.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: break_to_debug
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: ``ebreak`` instructions in U-mode enter Debug Mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: stepie
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
Enables/disables interrupts for single stepping.
The debugger must not change the value of this bit while the hart is running.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: disabled
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Interrupts are disabled during single stepping.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: enabled
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Interrupts are enabled during single stepping.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: stopcount
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Starts/stops incrementing counters in debug mode.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: dont_increment_counters
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Don’t increment any counters while in Debug Mode or on ``ebreak`` instructions that cause entry into Debug Mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: stoptime
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Starts/stops incrementing timers in debug mode.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: dont_increment_timers
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: Don’t increment any hart-local timers while in Debug Mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: cause
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
Explains why Debug Mode was entered.
When there are multiple reasons to enter Debug Mode in a single cycle, hardware sets ``cause`` to the cause with the highest priority.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: trigger_module
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: The Trigger Module caused a breakpoint exception. (priority 4, highest)

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: debugger_request
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: The debugger requested entry to Debug Mode using ``haltreq``. (priority 1)

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: single_step
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: The hart single stepped because ``step`` was set. (priority 0, lowest)

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: reset_halt
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: The hart halted directly out of reset due to ``resethaltreq``. It is also acceptable to report 3 when this happens. (priority 2)

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: mprven
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Enables/disables the modify privilege setting in debug mode.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: disable_mprv
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: MPRV in ``mstatus`` is ignored in Debug Mode.

ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:name: enable_mprv
ipxact:enumeratedValue.ipxact:description: MPRV in ``mstatus`` takes effect in Debug Mode.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: nmip
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When set, there is a Non-Maskable-Interrupt (NMI) pending for the hart.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: step
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: When set and not in Debug Mode, the hart will only execute a single instruction and then enter Debug Mode. If the instruction does not complete due to an exception, the hart will immediately enter Debug Mode before executing the trap handler, with appropriate exception registers set. The debugger must not change the value of this bit while the hart is running.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: prv
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Contains the privilege level the hart was operating in when Debug Mode was entered. A debugger can change this value to change the hart’s privilege level when exiting Debug Mode.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: dpc
ipxact:register.ipxact:description:
Upon entry to debug mode, ``dpc`` is updated with the virtual address of the next instruction to be executed.
When resuming, the hart’s PC is updated to the virtual address stored in ``dpc``. A debugger may write ``dpc`` to change where the hart resumes.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: dpc
ipxact:field.ipxact:description:
The ``dpc`` behavior is described in more detail in the table below.
.. csv-table:: :header: "Cause", "Virtual Address in DPC"
"``ebreak``", "Address of the ``ebreak`` instruction." "single step", "Address of the instruction that would be executed next if no debugging was going on. Ie. pc + 4 for 32-bit instructions that don’t change program flow, the destination PC on taken jumps/branches, etc." "trigger module", "If ``timing`` is 0, the address of the instruction which caused the trigger to fire. If ``timing`` is 1, the address of the next instruction to be executed at the time that debug mode was entered." "halt request", "Address of the next instruction to be executed at the time that debug mode was entered."

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: dscratch
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Optional scratch register. A debugger must not write to this register unless ``hartinfo`` explicitly mentions it.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: ftran
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Floating Point Custom CSR

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mcycle
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Counts the number of clock cycles executed by the processor core on which the hart is running.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: count
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Counts the number of clock cycles executed by the processor core.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: minstret
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Counts the number of instructions the hart has retired.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: count
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Counts the number of instructions the hart has retired.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mcycleh
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Counts the number of clock cycles executed by the processor core on which the hart is running.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: count
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Counts the number of clock cycles executed by the processor core.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: minstreth
ipxact:register.ipxact:displayName: Upper 32-bits of Machine Instruction Retired counter
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Counts the number of instructions the hart has retired.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: count
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Counts the number of instructions the hart has retired.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mhpmcounterh
ipxact:register.ipxact:displayName: Upper 32-bits of Machine Hardware Performance Monitoring Counter

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mvendorid
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This register provids the JEDEC manufacturer ID of the provider of the core.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: bank
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Contain encoding for number of one-byte continuation codes discarding the parity bit.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: offset
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Contain encording for the final byte discarding the parity bit.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: marchid
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This register encodes the base microarchitecture of the hart.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: architecture_id
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Provide Encoding the base microarchitecture of the hart.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mimpid
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: Provides a unique encoding of the version of the processor implementation.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: implementation
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Provides unique encoding of the version of the processor implementation.

ipxact:register.ipxact:name: mhartid
ipxact:register.ipxact:description: This register contains the integer ID of the hardware thread running the code.

ipxact:field.ipxact:name: hart_id
ipxact:field.ipxact:description: Contains the integer ID of the hardware thread running the code.
